title: Polymath projects home page
content: ## Collaboration This dataset is used to demonstrate Sophize's collaboration interface. We provide tools to aid Mathematicians that help them to solve problems collaboratively and share their discoveries with everyone. The interface crystallizes Profs. Timothy Gowers and Terry Tao's vision for large scale online collaborations. We have implemented all features they wished for (see this and this) and more. Here are a few highlights: 1. Hierarchical arrangement of Wiki-like pages for "Proof-discovery tree". 1. Visualization of proofs (including partial/in-progress) 1. Structured data organization (definitions, theorems, arguments) 1. $\LaTeX$ support 1. Group moderation 1. Comment auto-numbering, preview, editing We show how the polymath 14 project, initiated by Prof. Terry Tao on his blog, would benefit from Sophize's collaboration tools. Click the link below to see Polymath 14 hosted on Sophize: > #(J_polymath14, 'Polymath 14 on Sophize'|NAV_LINK) [comment]: # (Add link to video) --- ## Structured data In this dataset, you will also find the research paper where the results of the Polymath 14 project were published. We extract definitions, theorems, proofs, references, and keywords from this paper. This information gets added to Sophize pool of knowledge and provides a more productive environment for the reader to grasp the information contained in the literature.
